description.narrative:
The project aims to strengthen the role of young parliamentarians as advocate of the youth socio-economic rights through educate and sensitize them on youth SRH and life skills issues and to mobilize them to create favourable environment for youth to practice their rights. Project will also increase the capabilities of youth (age 18-29) at local level to better recognize and enjoy their socio-economic rights. Project will also contribute in the sustainable socio and economic development by providing advanced skill building opportunities to the poor rural youth including women and TGs of BISP communities through public -private partnership. Concept ofgender inclusive skill economic development and decent wages would be promoted through awareness raising and liaising with potential employers. Long term Impact: Empowered youth (women, men and transgender )of age 18-29 in Sindh and Punjab have increased accessto socio-economic rights(SRH, right to work) in an enabling environment
Out Comes: 1. Capacitated young parliamentarian negotiate on policy reforms (SRH related and youth economic development policies) with relevant government bodies to create enabling environment for youth (men, women, transgender) 2. Trained BISP youth(men, women and TG) from respective constituencies of YP on LSE have thecapabilities to practice their SRH rights in favourable environment 3. Youth (men, women and TGs) from BISP communities have accessto long term sustainable employment opportunities to enhance their livelihood

participating-org.narrative:
Young Parliamentarians Forum YPF is a forum established in 2003 with the purpose to help young legislators understand the issues that youth face, and to provide them with the knowledge and skills to be better lawmakers and ambassadors of tomorrow . It consists ofmembers who were 40 years of age or under at the time of election. This Forum is also expected to provide young legislators with the leadership skills to act as a catalyst for change in Pakistan<(>&<)>#39;s political system and pioneer meaningful reforms.
Current elected parliament beholds large percentage of youth many of whom are first time legislators. Thus this forum provides them with excellent opportunity to harness their energies and enthusiasm, develop and share ideas, improve their legislative and leadership skills to form inter regional and inter-party networks.
In order to perform their duties each young legislator must know how to initiate and support legislation (keeping in mind the ground realities) that can improve the conditions of their constituents. They must understand the imperatives of economic development, and must play a proactive role in policy making by keeping tabs on all the developments and limitations of developing policies within given frameworks of international powers. Furthermore any international events that may have a direct impact on our social, cultural and economic realities must be known inside out by them in order to work on all factors by keeping in mind its pragmatic effects at national and provincial level.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to basic social services
